00019 /*! \file
00020  * \brief Call Detail Record API 
00021  */
00022 
00023 #ifndef _ASTERISK_CDR_H
00024 #define _ASTERISK_CDR_H
00025 
00026 #include <sys/time.h>
00027 #define AST_CDR_FLAG_KEEP_VARS         (1 << 0)
00028 #define AST_CDR_FLAG_POSTED         (1 << 1)
00029 #define AST_CDR_FLAG_LOCKED         (1 << 2)
00030 #define AST_CDR_FLAG_CHILD       (1 << 3)
00031 #define AST_CDR_FLAG_POST_DISABLED     (1 << 4)
00032 
00033 #define AST_CDR_NULL                0
00034 #define AST_CDR_FAILED           (1 << 0)
00035 #define AST_CDR_BUSY          (1 << 1)
00036 #define AST_CDR_NOANSWER         (1 << 2)
00037 #define AST_CDR_ANSWERED         (1 << 3)
00038 
00039 /*! AMA Flags */
00040 #define AST_CDR_OMIT          (1)
00041 #define AST_CDR_BILLING          (2)
00042 #define AST_CDR_DOCUMENTATION       (3)
00043 
00044 #define AST_MAX_USER_FIELD       256
00045 #define AST_MAX_ACCOUNT_CODE        20
00046 
00047 /* Include channel.h after relevant declarations it will need */
00048 #include "asterisk/channel.h"
00049 #include "asterisk/utils.h"
00050 
00051 /*! Responsible for call detail data */
00052 struct ast_cdr {
00053    /*! Caller*ID with text */
00054    char clid[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
00055    /*! Caller*ID number */
00056    char src[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];     
00057    /*! Destination extension */
00058    char dst[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];     
00059    /*! Destination context */
00060    char dcontext[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];   
00061    
00062    char channel[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
00063    /*! Destination channel if appropriate */
00064    char dstchannel[AST_MAX_EXTENSION]; 
00065    /*! Last application if appropriate */
00066    char lastapp[AST_MAX_EXTENSION]; 
00067    /*! Last application data */
00068    char lastdata[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];   
00069    
00070    struct timeval start;
00071    
00072    struct timeval answer;
00073    
00074    struct timeval end;
00075    /*! Total time in system, in seconds */
00076    long int duration;            
00077    /*! Total time call is up, in seconds */
00078    long int billsec;          
00079    /*! What happened to the call */
00080    long int disposition;         
00081    /*! What flags to use */
00082    long int amaflags;            
00083    /*! What account number to use */
00084    char accountcode[AST_MAX_ACCOUNT_CODE];         
00085    /*! flags */
00086    unsigned int flags;           
00087    /* Unique Channel Identifier */
00088    char uniqueid[32];
00089    /* User field */
00090    char userfield[AST_MAX_USER_FIELD];
00091 
00092    /* A linked list for variables */
00093    struct varshead varshead;
00094 
00095    struct ast_cdr *next;
00096 };
00097 
00098 void ast_cdr_getvar(struct ast_cdr *cdr, const char *name, char **ret, char *workspace, int workspacelen, int recur, int raw);
00099 int ast_cdr_setvar(struct ast_cdr *cdr, const char *name, const char *value, int recur);
00100 int ast_cdr_serialize_variables(struct ast_cdr *cdr, struct ast_str **buf, char delim, char sep, int recur);
00101 void ast_cdr_free_vars(struct ast_cdr *cdr, int recur);
00102 int ast_cdr_copy_vars(struct ast_cdr *to_cdr, struct ast_cdr *from_cdr);

00104 typedef int (*ast_cdrbe)(struct ast_cdr *cdr);

00106 /*! \brief Return TRUE if CDR subsystem is enabled */
00107 int check_cdr_enabled(void);

00109 /*! \brief Allocate a CDR record 
00110  * Returns a malloc'd ast_cdr structure, returns NULL on error (malloc failure)
00111  */
00112 struct ast_cdr *ast_cdr_alloc(void);
00113 
00114 /*! \brief Duplicate a record 
00115  * Returns a malloc'd ast_cdr structure, returns NULL on error (malloc failure)
00116  */
00117 struct ast_cdr *ast_cdr_dup(struct ast_cdr *cdr);

00119 /*! \brief Free a CDR record 
00120  * \param cdr ast_cdr structure to free
00121  * Returns nothing
00122  */
00123 void ast_cdr_free(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00124 
00125 /*! \brief Discard and free a CDR record 
00126  * \param cdr ast_cdr structure to free
00127  * Returns nothing  -- same as free, but no checks or complaints
00128  */
00129 void ast_cdr_discard(struct ast_cdr *cdr);

00131 /*! \brief Initialize based on a channel
00132  * \param cdr Call Detail Record to use for channel
00133  * \param chan Channel to bind CDR with
00134  * Initializes a CDR and associates it with a particular channel
00135  * Return is negligible.  (returns 0 by default)
00136  */
00137 int ast_cdr_init(struct ast_cdr *cdr, struct ast_channel *chan);
00138 
00139 /*! Initialize based on a channel */
00140 /*! 
00141  * \param cdr Call Detail Record to use for channel
00142  * \param chan Channel to bind CDR with
00143  * Initializes a CDR and associates it with a particular channel
00144  * Return is negligible.  (returns 0 by default)
00145  */
00146 int ast_cdr_setcid(struct ast_cdr *cdr, struct ast_channel *chan);
00147 
00148 /*! Register a CDR handling engine */
00149 /*!
00150  * \param name name associated with the particular CDR handler
00151  * \param desc description of the CDR handler
00152  * \param be function pointer to a CDR handler
00153  * Used to register a Call Detail Record handler.
00154  * Returns -1 on error, 0 on success.
00155  */
00156 int ast_cdr_register(const char *name, const char *desc, ast_cdrbe be);
00157 
00158 /*! Unregister a CDR handling engine */
00159 /*!
00160  * \param name name of CDR handler to unregister
00161  * Unregisters a CDR by it's name
00162  */
00163 void ast_cdr_unregister(const char *name);
00164 
00165 /*! Start a call */
00166 /*!
00167  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00168  * Starts all CDR stuff necessary for monitoring a call
00169  * Returns nothing
00170  */
00171 void ast_cdr_start(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00172 
00173 /*! Answer a call */
00174 /*!
00175  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00176  * Starts all CDR stuff necessary for doing CDR when answering a call
00177  * NULL argument is just fine.
00178  */
00179 void ast_cdr_answer(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00180 
00181 /*! A call wasn't answered */
00182 /*!
00183  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00184  * Marks the channel disposition as "NO ANSWER"
00185  */
00186 extern void ast_cdr_noanswer(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00187 
00188 /*! Busy a call */
00189 /*!
00190  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00191  * Returns nothing
00192  */
00193 void ast_cdr_busy(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00194 
00195 /*! Fail a call */
00196 /*!
00197  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00198  * Returns nothing
00199  */
00200 void ast_cdr_failed(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00201 
00202 /*! Save the result of the call based on the AST_CAUSE_* */
00203 /*!
00204  * \param cdr the cdr you wish to associate with the call
00205  * Returns nothing
00206  * \param cause the AST_CAUSE_*
00207  */
00208 int ast_cdr_disposition(struct ast_cdr *cdr, int cause);
00209    
00210 /*! End a call */
00211 /*!
00212  * \param cdr the cdr you have associated the call with
00213  * Registers the end of call time in the cdr structure.
00214  * Returns nothing
00215  */
00216 void ast_cdr_end(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00217 
00218 /*! Detaches the detail record for posting (and freeing) either now or at a
00219  * later time in bulk with other records during batch mode operation */
00220 /*! 
00221  * \param cdr Which CDR to detach from the channel thread
00222  * Prevents the channel thread from blocking on the CDR handling
00223  * Returns nothing
00224  */
00225 void ast_cdr_detach(struct ast_cdr *cdr);
00226 
00227 /*! Spawns (possibly) a new thread to submit a batch of CDRs to the backend engines */
00228 /*!
00229  * \param shutdown Whether or not we are shutting down
00230  * Blocks the asterisk shutdown procedures until the CDR data is submitted.
00231  * Returns nothing
00232  */
00233 void ast_cdr_submit_batch(int shutdown);
00234 
00235 /*! Set the destination channel, if there was one */
00236 /*!
00237  * \param cdr Which cdr it's applied to
00238  * \param chan Channel to which dest will be
00239  * Sets the destination channel the CDR is applied to
00240  * Returns nothing
00241  */
00242 void ast_cdr_setdestchan(struct ast_cdr *cdr, const char *chan);
00243 
00244 /*! Set the last executed application */
00245 /*!
00246  * \param cdr which cdr to act upon
00247  * \param app the name of the app you wish to change it to
00248  * \param data the data you want in the data field of app you set it to
00249  * Changes the value of the last executed app
00250  * Returns nothing
00251  */
00252 void ast_cdr_setapp(struct ast_cdr *cdr, char *app, char *data);
00253 
00254 /*! Convert a string to a detail record AMA flag */
00255 /*!
00256  * \param flag string form of flag
00257  * Converts the string form of the flag to the binary form.
00258  * Returns the binary form of the flag
00259  */
00260 int ast_cdr_amaflags2int(const char *flag);
00261 
00262 /*! Disposition to a string */
00263 /*!
00264  * \param disposition input binary form
00265  * Converts the binary form of a disposition to string form.
00266  * Returns a pointer to the string form
00267  */
00268 char *ast_cdr_disp2str(int disposition);
00269 
00270 /*! Reset the detail record, optionally posting it first */
00271 /*!
00272  * \param cdr which cdr to act upon
00273  * \param flags |AST_CDR_FLAG_POSTED whether or not to post the cdr first before resetting it
00274  *              |AST_CDR_FLAG_LOCKED whether or not to reset locked CDR's
00275  */
00276 void ast_cdr_reset(struct ast_cdr *cdr, struct ast_flags *flags);
00277 
00278 /*! Flags to a string */
00279 /*!
00280  * \param flags binary flag
00281  * Converts binary flags to string flags
00282  * Returns string with flag name
00283  */
00284 char *ast_cdr_flags2str(int flags);
00285 
00286 /*! Move the non-null data from the "from" cdr to the "to" cdr
00287  * \param to   the cdr to get the goodies
00288  * \param from the cdr to give the goodies
00289  */
00290 void ast_cdr_merge(struct ast_cdr *to, struct ast_cdr *from);

00293 int ast_cdr_setamaflags(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *amaflags);

00301 int ast_cdr_update(struct ast_channel *chan);

00310 /*! Reload the configuration file cdr.conf and start/stop CDR scheduling thread */
00311 int ast_cdr_engine_reload(void);
00312 
00313 /*! Load the configuration file cdr.conf and possibly start the CDR scheduling thread */
00314 int ast_cdr_engine_init(void);

00316 /*! Submit any remaining CDRs and prepare for shutdown */
00317 void ast_cdr_engine_term(void);
